intro: Racosperma ausfeldii, commonly known as the Ausfeld's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with numerous small leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, arranged in dense, globular inflorescences. Racosperma ausfeldii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
